model

Class AbstractSolutionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractSolutionNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndSolutionNode, ArithmeticSolutionNode, EqualSolutionNode, NotSolutionNode, SimpleSentenceSolutionNode

    public abstract class AbstractSolutionNode
extends Object
    This class is the abstract class that gathers all the solution-node classes. A solution node is a node in a tree of proof.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSolutionNode

        public AbstractSolutionNode(Clause clause,
                    RuleSet rules,
                    SubstitutionSet parentSolution,
                    AbstractSolutionNode parentNode)
        Constructor of the class.
        Parameters:
        clause - the clause to be proved by this subtree.
        rules - the rules representing context of the proof.
        parentSolution - the solution of the parent node in the tree of proof.

    • Method Detail

      • nextSolution

        public abstract SubstitutionSet nextSolution()
        Creates the next solution for the clause of the node. If no solution exists, it will create a solution. Otherwise it will get a different solution or return null if there no other different solution.
        Returns:
        a SubstitutionSet object representing the bindings of the next solution or null if there is no next solution.

      • reset

        protected void reset(SubstitutionSet newParentSolution,
         RuleSet newRuleSet)
        Resets the subtree to the new state of the database and resets all the counters that prevent from infinite evaluation of the node.
        Parameters:
        newParentSolution - the new parent solution of the subtree.
        newRuleSet - the new state of the database.
        See Also:
        AndSolutionNode.reset(model.SubstitutionSet, model.RuleSet), ArithmeticSolutionNode.reset(model.SubstitutionSet, model.RuleSet), NotSolutionNode.reset(model.SubstitutionSet, model.RuleSet), SimpleSentenceSolutionNode.reset(model.SubstitutionSet, model.RuleSet)

      • currentRuleCount

        public int currentRuleCount()
        Gets the number of the current rule.
        Returns:
        the number of the current rule.

      • hasNextRule

        public boolean hasNextRule()
        Checks if there is another rule in the context rules.
        Returns:
        true if the current rule number is strictly below the number of rules.

      • nextRule

        public Rule nextRule()
        Gets the next rule to work with.
        Returns:
        a Rule object representing the next rule.

      • getParentSolution

        public SubstitutionSet getParentSolution()
        Gets the parent solution.
        Returns:
        a SubstitutionSet object that represents the parent solution.

      • getParentNode

        public AbstractSolutionNode getParentNode()
        Gets the parent node.
        Returns:
        an AbstractSolutionNode object that represents the parent node.

      • getRuleSet

        public RuleSet getRuleSet()
        Gets the context rules of the tree.
        Returns:
        a RuleSet object containing the context rules.

      • getCurrentRule

        public Rule getCurrentRule()
        Gets the rule on which the node is currently working.
        Returns:
        a Rule object representing the current rule.

      • getClause

        public Clause getClause()
        Gets the clause to prove in the context rules.
        Returns:
        a Clause object representing the clause to prove.

      • setDeepestLeaf

        public void setDeepestLeaf(AbstractSolutionNode leaf)
        Sets the deepest leaf to the specified leaf.
        Parameters:
        leaf - the deepest leaf of the tree (the one that failed).

      • getDeepestLeaf

        public AbstractSolutionNode getDeepestLeaf()
        Gets the deepest leaf of the tree.
        Returns:
        an AbstractSolutionNode object representing the deepest leaf of the tree.
